title: Smart data models - water process schema
description: The data model is intended to provide information about water process at water purification plant or water treatment plant

type.description: Property. NGSI Entity type. It has to be WaterProcess

waterProcessType.description: Property. Model:'https://schema.org/Text'. The type of water process at water purification plant or water treatment plant (aka. waste water treatment plant)

operationStatus.description: Property. Model:'https://schema.org/Text'.ss The operation status of the water proce

temperature.description: Property. Model:'https://schema.org/Number'. Units:'celsius'. The temperature of the processed water. All units are accepted in [CEFACT](https://www.unece.org/cefact.html) code

chromaticity.description: Property. Model:'https://schema.org/Number'. Units:'none'. The chromaticity of the processed water. All units are accepted in [CEFACT](https://www.unece.org/cefact.html) code

pH.description: Property. Acidity or basicity of an aqueous solution

alkalinity.description: Property. Model:'https://schema.org/Number'. Units:'cubic metre per second'. The intake volume of the pump station. All units are accepted in [CEFACT](https://www.unece.org/cefact.html) code

residualChlorine.description: Property. Model:'https://schema.org/Number'. Units:'cubic metre per second'. The intake volume of the pump station. All units are accepted in [CEFACT](https://www.unece.org/cefact.html) code

turbidity.description: Property. Amount of light scattered by particles in the water column. Unit:'NTU

bod.description: Property. Biochemical oxygen demand (BOD) is the amount of dissolved oxygen (DO) needed (i.e. demanded) by aerobic biological organisms to break down organic material present in a given water sample at certain temperature over a specific time period. Units:'mg/l'

cod.description: Property. Chemical oxygen demand (COD) is an indicative measure of the amount of oxygen that can be consumed by reactions in a measured solution. Units:'mg/l'

tss.description: Property. Total suspended solids. Model:'https://schema.org/Number'. Units:'mg/l'
